tag_list: web-design, print-design, photo-books, studio-lighting, cinematography, photography, ui-design, iphone-web-app-development, christian, tokyo, japan
overview:
Born in 1989, Miwaza is a Christian photographer and designer. Growing up in a big family and being part of the church all her life has influenced her work. She has been taking pictures since she was about 10 years old when she first “snatched away” her father’s digital camera.

Not only that she is a photographer but she is well known for her recent works as a cinematographer. Her recent works includes the web commercials that she shot and directed for a famous Japanese online store.

She started her carrier as a designer when she was about 13 years old. Her first official work was to design a intro flash animation for web sites. After doing several similar projects, she got into the world of print design as a graphic designer. She has been designing postcards, posters, brochures, business cards and other things since than. In 2006, she expanded her business by starting a T-shirt design company called Tshirt Farm.

In 2006, she won an award from Six Apart for her blog template design. It was the beginning of her carrier as a web designer. She designed numerous web sites and web applications, including iBibleApps by DuoPlus!. She experts in UI design and she plays a big role in iPhone web app development department at DuoPlus! as a designer and a developer.

She also enjoys both listening and composing musics, and she wrote many songs under the name â€œWhite Hawksâ€ for more than 6 years. She now leads a group â€œEvangelosâ€ as a main performer and a composer.
